intro: Scabiosa jacquinii, commonly known as the sweet William of the mountains, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine arrangements. Scabiosa jacquinii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
